name: Pop Rock
description: Fuses conventional verse-chorus song structure and especially melodic songwriting with usage of guitars, drums, and propulsive rhythms.

children.name: Beat
children.description: Emerged in the early 1960s in the United Kingdom, drawing on Rock & Roll and the late 1950s Skiffle revival in a simple guitar-band format with strong melodies.

children.name: Beat
children.description: Emerged in the early 1960s in the United Kingdom, drawing on Rock & Roll and the late 1950s Skiffle revival in a simple guitar-band format with strong melodies.

children.name: Beat Rock
children.description: Japan-exclusive subgenre which combines Pop melodicism with a punchy, driving sound drawing on Punk Rock and New Wave.

children.name: Beat Rock
children.description: Japan-exclusive subgenre which combines Pop melodicism with a punchy, driving sound drawing on Punk Rock and New Wave.

children.name: Big Music
children.description: Rooted in Post-Punk and popular in the 1980s, with anthemic songwriting and a grandiose, stadium-ready sound.

children.name: Big Music
children.description: Rooted in Post-Punk and popular in the 1980s, with anthemic songwriting and a grandiose, stadium-ready sound.

children.name: Britpop
children.description: Emerged in the United Kingdom in the early 1990s, with a style hearkening back to the traditional guitar-driven songs and melodic hooks found in the British Pop Rock of the 1960s.

children.name: Britpop
children.description: Emerged in the United Kingdom in the early 1990s, with a style hearkening back to the traditional guitar-driven songs and melodic hooks found in the British Pop Rock of the 1960s.

children.name: Jangle Pop
children.description: Treble-heavy guitars with arpeggiated melodies, distinct basslines, and often propulsive, repetitive strum-rhythms; frequently influenced by Post-Punk.

children.name: Jangle Pop
children.description: Treble-heavy guitars with arpeggiated melodies, distinct basslines, and often propulsive, repetitive strum-rhythms; frequently influenced by Post-Punk.

children.name: Piano Rock
children.description: Primarily based around piano riffs and melodies, rather than having guitar as the focal instrument.

children.name: Piano Rock
children.description: Primarily based around piano riffs and melodies, rather than having guitar as the focal instrument.

children.name: Pop Yeh-Yeh
children.description: Blends Western Beat and Psychedelia styles with asli singing and melodies drawn from Malay Folk Music.

children.name: Pop Yeh-Yeh
children.description: Blends Western Beat and Psychedelia styles with asli singing and melodies drawn from Malay Folk Music.

children.name: Post-Britpop
children.description: Emerged in the late 1990s as a Britpop expansion mainly characterized by acoustic-leaning instrumentation, lush string arrangements, and mid-tempo song structures, as well as less apparent lyrical concerns for Britain in favor of introspective, contemplative themes.

children.name: Post-Britpop
children.description: Emerged in the late 1990s as a Britpop expansion mainly characterized by acoustic-leaning instrumentation, lush string arrangements, and mid-tempo song structures, as well as less apparent lyrical concerns for Britain in favor of introspective, contemplative themes.

children.name: Power Pop
children.description: Combines 1960s Pop melodies with loud power chords; characterized by prominent, sometimes jangly electric guitars, clear vocals, crisp harmonies, and economical arrangements.

children.name: Power Pop
children.description: Combines 1960s Pop melodies with loud power chords; characterized by prominent, sometimes jangly electric guitars, clear vocals, crisp harmonies, and economical arrangements.

children.name: Soft Rock
children.description: Clean production and light instrumentation paired with harmonious, radio-friendly songwriting; gained huge commercial success in the 1970s.

children.name: Soft Rock
children.description: Clean production and light instrumentation paired with harmonious, radio-friendly songwriting; gained huge commercial success in the 1970s.

children.name: Stereo
children.description: Burmese Pop Rock genre which emerged in the mid-1960s.

children.name: Stereo
children.description: Burmese Pop Rock genre which emerged in the mid-1960s.

children.name: Twee Pop
children.description: Distinct Post-Punk background and often jangling guitars, defined by a cute aesthetic and lyrics combined with an indie/DIY attitude and a simplicity often indebted to Punk Rock.

children.name: Twee Pop
children.description: Distinct Post-Punk background and often jangling guitars, defined by a cute aesthetic and lyrics combined with an indie/DIY attitude and a simplicity often indebted to Punk Rock.

children.name: Vocal Surf
children.description: Appropriates the sounds of instrumental Surf Rock, combining surfing- and car-themed lyrics with a style that draws primarily from Doo-Wop and Rock & Roll.

children.name: Vocal Surf
children.description: Appropriates the sounds of instrumental Surf Rock, combining surfing- and car-themed lyrics with a style that draws primarily from Doo-Wop and Rock & Roll.
